section_name: Classification of Radiolarian Fossil Zones and Environmental Analysis of Gufeng Formation in Lower Yangtze Region (Page 1), Gujingling Section (Page 1), Gujingling Section (Page 1), Gujingling Section (Page 2), Gujingling Section (Page 5), Gujingling Section (Page 7)
location_of_the_samples_and_sections: 2 km southwest of Xiaodong, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, China (Page 2), Bancheng Formation in South China (Page 1), Middle part of the Gujingling Section (GJL 6-B to 12-B) (Page 5), Southwest Japan (Page 7), Xiaodong and Bancheng Counties of Qinzhou Area, SE Guangxi (Page 1), Xiaodong, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, China (Page 1)
associated_fossils: Al-baillellaria, spherical radiolaria, Latentifistularia, Entactinaria, hexactinellids, demosponges (Page 1), Hegleria mammilla, Latentifistula texana, Pseudotormentus kamigoriensis, and Quadrimis glacilis (Page 5), Radiolaria and sponge spicules (Page 8), Radiolarian and sponge spicule faunas (Page 1), conodonts, brachiopods, and bivalves (Page 0)
lithology: Cherts and siliceous siltstones (Page 1), Cherty Facies (Page 1), Red-to-yellow red cherts and yellow-to-yellow brown siliceous siltstones (Page 8), Siliceous siltstones (Page 1), red-to-yellow red cherts and yellow-to-yellow brown siliceous siltstones (Page 2)
